result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already provided.
Complete AODA assessment  and follow through with all recommendations at discretion of agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Participate in counseling as deemed necessary by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L. Stein

records.addlTxt: On def's failure to pay the fine, Court orders 10 days jail.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 3:43 PM Defendant Christopher L. Stein appeared in person, in custody in Langlade County Jail. Attorney John Zich in court in person for Christopher L. Stein. Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement terms and Def. is to plea guilty or no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3. Ct. 4 to be dismissed but read in, joint recommendation on Ct. 1. Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, Def. to pay court costs with DNA surcharge and Def. to provide DNA sample, AODA treatments and follow through with treatment recommendation, maintain absolute sobriety, fulltime employment or 100 hours of community service and counselling as deemed necessary. Ct. 2 imposed/stayed 1 year in jail, 2 years of probation to run concurrent, pay court costs on DNA Surcharge. Ct. 3 Jail time served and Def. to pay court costs of DNA surcharge. Information was filed. Atty Zich is in agreement. Def. is also in agreement. Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Def. pleas no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3, as a repeater. Court grants States motion to dismiss and read in Ct. 4 and reviews Def. constitutional rights and elements as well as potential penalties. Atty Zich has reviewed plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with Def. and is satisfied. Court finds Def. has entered pleas freely and voluntarily and has reviewed the criminal complaint, finds adequate and factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty on Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3, as a repeater. State makes sentencing recommendations. Atty Zich makes sentencing remarks. Def. makes statement. Court reviews sentencing factors and orders Ct. 1 withheld sentence, 3 years probation, Def. to pay court costs including $250 DNA surcharge, Complete AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations at discretion of agent, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Maintain full time employment, participate in counselling as deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 1 year County jail sentence imposed/stayed with Huber, probation 2 years, court costs to include $200 DNA surcharge. Same conditions of probation in Ct. 1.  Ct. 3 time served jail sentence, costs only including DNA surcharge. 85 days time served to be applied to Ct. 3. No remaining credit if revoked. Firearms and voting rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Court questions Def. on Ct. 3 court costs. Court reviews payment plan terms and postconviction rights. State is satisfied. Atty Zich makes remarks regarding Brown County probation. Payment plan on Ct. 3 and DNA sample if not already provided.

3:05 PM in Room 203. Defendant Christopher L. Stein appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Christopher L. Stein. All appearances are by Zoom. Court reviews charges and rights to preliminary hearing. Waiver reviewed. Def. waives preliminary hearing. Court questions Def. Attny Zich is satisfied with Def.'s understanding. The Court finds that Def. understands and that waiver is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for filing of Information. State has filed Information and has efiled to Attny Zich. Attny Zich acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters pleas of not guilty to all charges, reserves objections. The Court receives pleas of not guilty for all four counts.  Attny Zich will contact JA for possible sentencing date but STC to be set. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bond
(routed to Judge's JA)

1:43 PM Defendant Christopher L. Stein appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Christopher L. Stein, via zoom .  Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading and request timely ph. CC. heard on time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:42 PM Defendant Christopher L. Stein appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Def. has spoken to PD. and makes statement.  Def. filed a bond reduction
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

01:20 PM in Room 301. Defendant Christopher L. Stein in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher L. Stein appeared by video means.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. wants attorney, will contact PD. State heard on bond. Def. on PO hold. Recommends $5,000 cash bond with condition no illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $3,000 cash with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
